page.title: 08OATCAKE FACTORY
page.content: This local business is owned by the Stockan family who moved to new expanded premises in 1982.The family work and employ 16 local people to make ther traditional shape of oatcake _ a quarter circle. To make the oatcakes they need oatmeal,flour,veg.fat,salt and sugar,raising agents which all get mixed together and baked at a moderate heat .All the ingredients are imported .Of the half million oatcakes produced each week many are exported to small stores in Aberdeen and Inverness or even to Dumfries ,although the company does not advertise.Despite high freight charges ,Mr Stockan sells 36 packets for Â£5.30.He's up at 6.45 for each busy day's work.It's worth it,for although not the most popular oatcake in Britain,in Orkney more of them are sold than rich tea biscuits.
